text: by July 25, 2025Source: YouTube "I don't have much to lose, but I have everything to gain – that's why I'm here." Dang, this looks fantastic! Lionsgate has marched out the second trailer for The Long Walk, an extremely intense new thriller from filmmakers Francis Lawrence & JT Mollner about a dystopian America. Based on storyteller Stephen King’s first-written novel, and Francis Lawrence, director of The Hunger Games films, comes this grueling story of boys out on a never-ending walk. In the near future, where America has become a police state, one hundred boys are selected to enter an annual contest where the winner will be awarded whatever he wants for the rest of his life. The brutal game is simple - maintain a steady walking pace of three miles per hour without stopping. Three warnings, and you're out – forever. It's win or die, on this walk. Starring Cooper Hoffman (from Licorice Pizza, Saturday Night) + David Jonsson (from Alien: Romulus), Garrett Wareing, Tut Nyuot, Charlie Plummer, Ben Wang, Roman Griffin Davis, Jordan Gonzalez, Joshua Odjick, Josh Hamilton, with Judy Greer, and Mark Hamill. This still looks like it might be one of the most riveting, full-on edge-of-your-seat thrillers of the year. All that walking, so crazy tiring, I can't even imagine. Here's the second official trailer for Francis Lawrence's movie The Long Walk, direct from YouTube: You can watch the first official trailer for Francis Lawrence's The Long Walk movie right here to see more. From the highly anticipated adaptation of master storyteller Stephen King’s first-written novel (originally published in 1979), along with Francis Lawrence, the visionary director of The Hunger Games franchise films (Catching Fire, Mockingjay – Parts 1 & 2 , and The Ballad of Songbirds & Snakes), comes The Long Walk, an intense, chilling, emotional thriller that challenges audiences to confront a haunting question: how far could you go? The Long Walk is directed by acclaimed filmmaker Francis Lawrence, director of the movies Constantine, I Am Legend, Water for Elephants, Hunger Games: Catching Fire + Mockingjay 1 & 2 + The Ballad of Songbirds & Snakes, Red Sparrow, and Slumberland previously. The screenplay is written by JT Mollner, also the writer & director of the films Outlaws & Angels and Strange Darling. Based on the novel of the same name by Stephen King (under the pseudonym Richard Bachman). Produced by Roy Lee, Steven Schneider, Francis Lawrence, Cameron MacConomy. Lionsgate will debut Lawrence's The Long Walk movie in theaters nationwide starting September 12th, 2025 later this year. Thoughts? Look good? Find more posts in: Horror, To Watch, Trailer

by
July 25, 2025
Source: YouTube

"I don't have much to lose, but I have everything to gain – that's why I'm here." Dang, this looks fantastic! Lionsgate has marched out the second trailer for The Long Walk, an extremely intense new thriller from filmmakers Francis Lawrence & JT Mollner about a dystopian America. Based on storyteller Stephen King’s first-written novel, and Francis Lawrence, director of The Hunger Games films, comes this grueling story of boys out on a never-ending walk. In the near future, where America has become a police state, one hundred boys are selected to enter an annual contest where the winner will be awarded whatever he wants for the rest of his life. The brutal game is simple - maintain a steady walking pace of three miles per hour without stopping. Three warnings, and you're out – forever. It's win or die, on this walk. Starring Cooper Hoffman (from Licorice Pizza, Saturday Night) + David Jonsson (from Alien: Romulus), Garrett Wareing, Tut Nyuot, Charlie Plummer, Ben Wang, Roman Griffin Davis, Jordan Gonzalez, Joshua Odjick, Josh Hamilton, with Judy Greer, and Mark Hamill. This still looks like it might be one of the most riveting, full-on edge-of-your-seat thrillers of the year. All that walking, so crazy tiring, I can't even imagine.

Here's the second official trailer for Francis Lawrence's movie The Long Walk, direct from YouTube:

You can watch the first official trailer for Francis Lawrence's The Long Walk movie right here to see more.

From the highly anticipated adaptation of master storyteller Stephen King’s first-written novel (originally published in 1979), along with Francis Lawrence, the visionary director of The Hunger Games franchise films (Catching Fire, Mockingjay – Parts 1 & 2 , and The Ballad of Songbirds & Snakes), comes The Long Walk, an intense, chilling, emotional thriller that challenges audiences to confront a haunting question: how far could you go? The Long Walk is directed by acclaimed filmmaker Francis Lawrence, director of the movies Constantine, I Am Legend, Water for Elephants, Hunger Games: Catching Fire + Mockingjay 1 & 2 + The Ballad of Songbirds & Snakes, Red Sparrow, and Slumberland previously. The screenplay is written by JT Mollner, also the writer & director of the films Outlaws & Angels and Strange Darling. Based on the novel of the same name by Stephen King (under the pseudonym Richard Bachman). Produced by Roy Lee, Steven Schneider, Francis Lawrence, Cameron MacConomy. Lionsgate will debut Lawrence's The Long Walk movie in theaters nationwide starting September 12th, 2025 later this year. Thoughts? Look good?
